result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A. Doverspike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd A. Doverspike is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Todd A. Doverspike was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond be applied to costs/surcharges with balance forfeited.
Follow conditions as set by DOC.

timeConds.notes: Serve one (1) year in the Pepin County Jail with three (3) months stayed for DOC agent to impose as needed.  Huber privileges granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A. Doverspike

records.addlTxt: Hearing removed.  DOC showed CO Obs owing which were paid in full.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $518.00 of the $5000 bond ordered be applied to costs with balance forfeited.
Count 1 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion.

Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends felony bail jumping without repeater allegation.   Court advises defendant of count 2 without the repeater allegation/max. penalties.  Plea Colloquy.  Defendant pleads guilty.   Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count of felony bail jumping, not as a repeater.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with conditions.  Advised of appeal rights.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  February 23, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
Sentencing hearing at 02-23-2016 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 02-23-2016 11:00 am
$518 ORDERED to be applied to costs, balance forfeited
Order $5000 bond be forfeited except $518 applied to court costs.
Count 1 Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court here on plea hearing.  Defendant will plead to 1 count of felony bail jumping set forth in 15CF10, State will dismiss other charges and $5000 bond forfeiture defendant doesn't dispute to apply bond to costs and forfeit the balance.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties, constitional rights and felony prohibitions.  Defendant pleads guilty to felony bail jumping.  Counsel stipulates facts support the charge.  Court accepts plea, finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly & understandingly waives his constitutional rights, finds defendant guilty.  Other charges dismissed. Order bond be forfeited except $518 applied to court costs.  Order PSI.  Contact scheduling clerk for sentencing date.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing at 11-24-2015 03:00 pm
Motion to Forfeit Bail.
Status conference at 10-27-2015 01:30 pm
Atty. S. Joseph Randtke has been appointed.
Status conference at 09-22-2015 02:00 pm
The Court having reviewed the Motion to Withdraw as Counsel... makes the following Order:  Attorney Haley Wright's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Todd Doverspike is hereby granted.
Atty Haley Wright requests permission to withdraw my appearance as attorney for Todd Doverspike....

Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court with attorney Haley Breese Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wright informs the court she filed a motion for bond modification and today the State informs they may move to forfeit the bond.  Initial appearance held on 2015CF40.  State requests bond in 2015CF40 be same as bond in this case but no need to post another $5000.  No objection by counsel.  Atty Wright requests bond be reduced to signature as defendant is indigent and for reasons stated in motion.  State objects due to defendant's long criminal history, open cases in Dunn County 2/6/15, 3/3/15; since bond set on this case, defendant charged again in Dunn County 15CF243, 11 count complaint; at this time not making motion to forfeit bond, ask court deny motion for modification.  Court finds bond as set is appropriate.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.
Motion hearing at 08-25-2015 03:15 pm
Dismissing the Information and reinstating the original information.

State has no objection the the Court dismissing the amending information and reinstating the original information containing 2 counts, first attempt possession of meth, class I felony, and 2 felony bail jumping class H felony.  Court so orders.
Letter from Pepin County District Attorney to Judge Boles re: Atty Wright's Motion regarding the Amended Information.  cc:  Haley Wright

Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court with attorney Haley Breese Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wright informs the court she just received an Amended Information, plea already entered to original charging document, don't think repeater & penalty enhancement can be added 971.29(1).  State moves to amend information.  Atty Wright notes the Information was not filed at time of court.  Court needs to look into this issue.  State to file written arguments by 6/26/15; Defense counsel respond by 7/13/15.  Court will review briefs and make decision.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Amended Information.
Amended Information
Status conference at 06-10-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge

Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court with attorney Haley Breese Wright.  Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests joint preliminary hearings in 15CF10 & 15CF11.  Counsel for defendants requests separate preliminary hearings.  Court orders preliminary hearings joined.  State calls Investigator Engfer - Sworn & testified.  Cross by counsel.  Closing comments by State. Atty Wright moves to dismiss both counts.  Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and binds defendant over.  Atty Wright requests $5000.00 cash bond be converted to Signature Bond.  Court orders bond remain as set.
J. VA. is required to appear on 04/14/2015 at 1:00 pm
L.E. is required to appear on 04/14/2015 at 1:00 pm

Preliminary hearing at 04-14-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Patrick William Waters in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights, right to preliminary hearing.  Atty Waters requests modification of cash bond.  State objects and requests bond remain as set.  Court orders bond as set for reasons indicated.  Defendant qualifies for SPD, a new attorney will need to be appointed.  Matter to be set at same time as Pfenning.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-07-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Todd A. Doverspike in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Advised of right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
